title: Zyra build help/support questions
body: I have been playing mostly Zyra. I just played my first intermediate bot game on Summoner's Rift. We won, but my bot lane partner was very disgruntled with my build. And he didn't want me taking any CS. What I don't understand is: How do I get enough gold to buy good build items without CS?? I am not fast. I am a mana hog. I am very squishy. I also need a lot of ability. That all requires a ton of diverse items from the store. I'm at a loss. I was doing fine playing beginner and no one seemed to care about my preferred build (leading up to increased speed, ability and attack speed: I usually always get Talisman of Ascension, some sort of boots and something else for more ability). What am I doing wrong? I start off very weak, but can build into something pretty strong. I feel like maybe I am missing some intermediate mid priced items maybe. I like to save my gold to buy the big ticket stuff. Is this unwise?

replies.body:
bots...anyone %%%%%ing about taking CS needs to be shot in the face! bots isnt for 0 CS support...its for having fun and learning things.

get blue support item on zyra, ALWAYS. max Q. Q enemies and auto them as often as needed. or just get a plant to auto them, W Q near enemies. usually gets 1-2 procs off no worries.

frost queens claim, chalice into either athenes or mikaels, liandries torment, banner of command and some AR item like zonyas. sorc/CDR or any defensive boots work well. (CDR only if you go mikaels instead of athenes and only if you really want CDR max early)

I'll do some dot points

- as a support you don't take cs UNLESS your adc isn't in lane and the tower would otherwise kill them, which is when it's ok for the sup to take them as it's not losing your adc gold.

- You get gold from your support item (the coin / shield / spellthing) which grant you gold based on their description 

- You shouldn't use mana unless you're trying to achieve something in lane, try auto attacking the enemy to poke down their health before using mana

- As a support you need to build specifically to SUPPORT, just remember that.

- Don't ever get attack speed on zyra, you need primarily AP to deal damage.

- on zyra get {{item:3098}} not {{item:3069}} (she's an aggressive support, coin is more for passive play)

- boots should almost always be {{item:3117}} on support

- don't save gold, your general build should be (to start the game off);

{{item:3303}} {{item:2003}} {{item:2003}} {{item:2004}} {{item:2004}}  {{item:3340}} 

first time you go back to base have atleast 800 gold

purchase {{item:2049}}  and also sell your {{item:3340}} and buy {{item:3341}} (because you have infinite wards now)

if you also have the gold purchase boots or upgrade your support item ect.
Thank you! I love that you told me to to have at least 800 gold the first time I go back. It's stuff like that I really appreciate :)

To BarryButcher and KingDinger: I took your advise and totally changed my item build to reflect what you suggested. To my delight, taking a gold generating item really, really does make a difference in terms of not hitting the minions myself. I really didn't know that those gold generating items were truly that useful. When you just read numbers and stats, you just don't understand what an item will really do for you until you use it. I've definitely improved even just over the last two days. Thank you.

With all of the other advice in mind, you are gonna have a lot of trouble with adcs getting angry at you for taking cs because any plants you summon will probably aggro onto the minions. When this happens, just ignore them and try to position your plants more carefully. 

Zyra support takes ages to learn and a lot of skill to play well, so keep at it and good luck ♥

Thank you. Yes, I def find that my plants can unintentionally do that so I've been trying to hold back on planting seeds when I can. It's definitely hard though to figure out in which cases seeds are necessary and in which cases they are not. Sometimes when I plant seeds in my R (activated by my Q) they just keep on firing and firing and sometimes take away someone else's kill :( . I usually try to tell whomever I'm playing with that if something like that happens it is not on purpose and I'm still learning...Some people get it and some don't.
Wow, thank you all so much for the advise! I will def work on these things.
you dont EVER need attack speed on zyra....thats why your build was criticized...
